intro: Asemeia tonsa, commonly known as the common meadow violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Asemeia tonsa has a fibrous root system and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in early successional plant communities.
